body:
**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
master.

**What happened**:
Unstructured converter from `apimachinery/pkg/conversion/unstructured` does not roundtrip `apimachinery/pkg/apis/meta/v1/unstructured.Unstructured`.

**What you expected to happen**:
When I call `ToUnstructured()` on a `runtime.Object` which is backed by `*Unstructured` it should basically make a copy of the content (can be optimized btw using deep copy #40657) and not a json object with `object` key.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
See the test in my branch https://github.com/atlassian/kubernetes/commit/7cd448300025604622b5eae8f3a966fa5b9dbe4c
Test output:
```
make test WHAT=./vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/apis/meta/v1/unstructured KUBE_GOFLAGS="-v"
Running tests for APIVersion: v1,admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1alpha1,admission.k8s.io/v1alpha1,apps/v1beta1,authentication.k8s.io/v1,authentication.k8s.io/v1beta1,authorization.k8s.io/v1,authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1,autoscaling/v1,autoscaling/v2alpha1,batch/v1,batch/v2alpha1,certificates.k8s.io/v1beta1,extensions/v1beta1,imagepolicy.k8s.io/v1alpha1,networking.k8s.io/v1,policy/v1beta1,rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1,rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1alpha1,settings.k8s.io/v1alpha1,storage.k8s.io/v1beta1,storage.k8s.io/v1,federation/v1beta1
+++ [0622 14:34:54] Running tests without code coverage
=== RUN   TestUnstructuredList
--- PASS: TestUnstructuredList (0.00s)
=== RUN   TestConversionRoundtrip
--- FAIL: TestConversionRoundtrip (0.00s)
        unstructured_test.go:112: FromUnstructured failed: Object 'Kind' is missing in '{"object":{"apiVersion":"v1","kind":"Foo","metadata":{"name":"foo1"}}}'
FAIL
exit status 1
FAIL    k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/apis/meta/v1/unstructured      0.050s
make: *** [test] Error 1
```

**Anything else we need to know**:
For some reason #36721 changed the argument types from `runtime.Object` to `interface{}`. I guess the intent is to make the converter a more generic tool. But based on the previous signature I assume I'm doing the right thing. Actually, my code works with `runtime.Object` and I don't know if the actual object behind the interface is an `*Unstructured` or not - I just pass it to the converter and it works for usual API types, but not for unstructured.
Also it would be useful to have a more type-safe version of the converter (i.e. the previous signature) that just delegates to a lower-level converter that does not care about types.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: Unstructured converter does not roundtrip Unstructured object
